text: Joseph Safina (born December 8, 1967) is an American race car driver. He competed in the 24 Hours of Daytona, Grand Am Rolex Sports Car Series, and IMSA GT. He was the first to race a Lamborghini GTR at the 12 Hours of Sebring and drove the Florida Marlins sponsored Porsche in the 2009 IMSA SportsCar Championship. == Biography == Safina was born in Fort Lauderdale, Florida. Safina began racing cars professionally in 1990 and is the head of Safina Racing. He has competed in the Grand-Am Rolex Sports Car Series, the 12 Hours of Sebring, and the 24 Hours of Daytona, finishing in the top ten five times. Safina also placed third at Homestead in the GT class and achieved international podium finishes, including the 24 Hours of Dubai. He first raced a Lamborghini GTR at Sebring and drove a Marlins-sponsored Porsche in the 2009 IMSA Championship. He is the founder of Safina Asset Management and co-founder of Nichols, Safina, Lerner & Co. == References == Category:1967 births Category:Living people Category:American racecar drivers Category:People from Fort Lauderdale, Florida
title: Joseph Safina
